attributes.action: For schools to teach children ages 6-15 the mental damage bullying can do.
attributes.background:
Bullying- some school's have excellent policies for it where as some don't.
Bullying is becoming more viral on the internet and social networks.
Although they may get punished somehow for this do they actually realise what they are doing to that person mentally?
attributes.additional_details:
Educating children in schools the effects bullying has on a person's mental health and how it will effect their future.
When you are young you don't realise what you are doing you just think your the cool hard kid wanting everyone's attention, therefor not thinking about what you are doing to that person.
So making it part of a weekly lesson can help children understand that bullying will effect people in later life and also effect their schooling and education.

attributes.action: Review the cases of each of the 3859 prisoners still held under IPP scheme
attributes.background: As of September, 3,859 prisoners were still in custody after being sentenced to an IPP and more than 8/10 were beyond the expiry date of the original sentence. IPP was scrapped in 2012. What they have served is disproportionate to the crimes they have committed.

attributes.action: Call a General Election that allows 16-17 year old people to vote.
attributes.background: The next PM is unelected this is not democratic, an election should have happened when Gordon Brown took office don't allow this to happen again. 16 and 17 year olds are competent and understand that their vote can make a difference and so should be allowed to vote.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.electoral-reform.org.uk/votes-at-16
http://www.voteat16.ie/nine_reasons
http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/lord-wallace/eu-referendum-young-voters_b_8280774.html

After all a 16-year-old in Britain can get married, pay tax and join the army, so why on earth should they not be allowed to take part in the democratic process, especially when it involves a decision that greatly affects them?

attributes.action: Erect a statue of Jo Cox in Parliament Square.
attributes.background: Jo Cox was brutally murdered at her constituency surgery.  Jo was a well loved and respected campaigner and MP who always stood up for others.  Parliament Square has 11 statues, none of women.

attributes.action: Transport Minister Patrick McLoughlin Cap Or Further Subsidise Train Fares
attributes.background: Train fares are just too costly for the average commuter/traveller. 35 minutes away from a main city can cost a yearly total of £3,320.00 which accounts for 12.7% of the average national salary. This figure is too high and continues to increase. Hence, we are calling on a cap or further subsidy.
attributes.additional_details:
"Since privatisation, the average price of a train journey has increased by 22% and walk-on tickets on some routes have been hiked by 245%. The TUC looked at the cost of UK rail commutes against similar European journeys in France, Germany and Spain. It found that we’re paying 3x more of our salary just to get to work and back." - (The Independent) 
http://www.independent.co.uk/travel/uk/why-are-uk-rail-fares-so-expensive-9678640.html

attributes.action: Increase verification to decrease the fraud in scrapping a stolen vehicle.
attributes.background:
Vehicles presented for scrapping by a thief can currently disappear if no V5 is presented on arrival at the scrapyard.
There is no electronic information or cross checking link between DVLA and police forces in the UK.
Remove the facility of cashing the cheque to the thief by the scrapyard.
attributes.additional_details: This follows an incident with a rare vehicle which after being stolen, disappeared, was effectively crushed, and all that happened before any checks could be made.

attributes.action: Stop the resale of concert tickets at inflated prices on secondary websites.
attributes.background: Tickets sell out in record time!  then we see them for "resale" within hours on secondary ticket sale websites at ridiculously inflated prices. Reselling of football tickets is illegal under section 166 Criminal Justice and Public Order Act 1994", why can this law not apply to concert tickets?
attributes.additional_details:
The Which Reports can be found;

http://www.which.co.uk/news/2015/11/which-probes-ticket-resale-rip-off-422307/

and

http://www.which.co.uk/news/2016/05/event-tickets-still-being-sold-unlawfully-443074/
Report in Daily Telegraph relating to the recent sale of Phil Colllins Tickets at The Royal Albert Hall
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/10/21/fan-fury-as-phil-collins-tickets-sell-out-in-15-seconds---only-t/

attributes.action: Stop the UK from recognising child marriage conducted abroad as legal.
attributes.background:
The UK recognises child marriage provided they were conducted "legally" abroad & also for benefit purposes.
It is illegal to marry under 18 yrs of age in the UK (16 years with parental consent) & these child marriages should not be recognised by the UK in any form. The adult should be prosecuted.
attributes.additional_details:
Today Save the Children estimated that a girl marries under the age of 15 years every 7 second seconds within the world.
In recognising the child marriages of immigrants to the UK (including for benefit purposes) we do nothing to stop this child abuse.

attributes.action: Move parliament away from the Palace of Westminster to Carlisle, Cumbria
attributes.background: London-centric government leads to a distorted view of the UK and a disproportionate distribution of resource. The Northern Power House discussion mistakenly sees the Merseyside/Manchester/Leeds axis as the North of England. Government from Carlisle will shift more than just the base of politics.
attributes.additional_details: The problems of poor infrastructure, transport and communication can be ignored while the British Government continues to rule from Westminster. The North East has at least reasonable transport links; Cumbria boasts two lane trunk roads. Much of Cumbria has poor mobile signal and even poorer broadband.  What might change if the Government had to try to function in that environment.  This time Cumbria, after 10 years perhaps another northern county, then perhaps Cornwall!

attributes.action: Increase funding on nursing homes to lower the cost of carehomes for families.
attributes.background: We visited a nursing home and were disheartened by the patients' solitude. Our hearts were torn by watching the elderly in care being so fragile and frail, armed with the knowledge that they receive such little funding. So we have started a campaign in conjunction with this

attributes.action: Provide the date when permanent residence was acquired through EEA regulations
attributes.background: Since the 12 November 2015 to apply for naturalisation EEA nationals and their non EEA family members must have been issued with a document certifying permenanet residence (DCPR) or with a permanent residency card (PRC), but the date when permanent residence was acquired is not reported on either.
attributes.additional_details:
In general to apply for naturalisation one must have indefinite leave to stay in the UK for the last 12 months of residence. The Home Office Nationality Policy Team has been advising via FOI that for whose requesting DCPRs or PRCs "the date that they were deemed to have acquired permanent residence will be recorded on UKVI’s database and so will be clear to the nationality caseworker".
Not providing the date to the applicants, except than by SAR, increases red tape and slows down naturalisations

attributes.action: Change the law so child sex offenders do not have contact with their children
attributes.background: Most children are protected by the law in areas that prevents child sex offenders having access to places where children are present . However children of sex offenders are not privy to the protection and given access to manipulators and grooming behaviour under supervision of unqualified people.
attributes.additional_details: If a child isn't a social services child , and the other parent poses no threat then social services will not supervise,or provide centres. As a result it forces the supervisor which may be a family member or ex partner, to have them into their homes or be witnessed by others associating with a known sex offender. This may put the child's safety at risk .If the supervisor isn't educated about grooming they may inadvertadly put the child at risk.Why are our children not worth adequate protection?

attributes.action: A vote of no confidence in Boris Johnson as the UK's foreign secretary.
attributes.background: Boris Johnson has consistently demonstrated a lack of awareness towards Europe and the rest of the world. Why would we, citizens of the United Kingdom allow this man to represent us in Europe and the rest of the world as our foreign secretary?

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for alcoholic drinks to display it's nutritional information
attributes.background: It is the law to display nutritional information on all food and drink except for alcoholic drinks. Many people use this information for any dietary issues they may have, from a simple diet to type 1 diabetes. Without nutritional information it is impossible to consume alcohol for some people.
attributes.additional_details: Alcohol is extremely calorific and I believe people would change their views on how much they drink if they knew what was in what they drink. Also being diabetic myself, I have to use insulin depending on how much carbohydrate I consume, which is impossible to know with alcohol, and could pose and extremely dangerous health risk.

attributes.action: All Government forms, publications in English or English/Welsh languages only.
attributes.background:
All Government forms and publications should be printed in English or English/Welsh languages only.
The public sector is estimated to spend  140 million a year on translation services.
attributes.additional_details:
Local councils spend at least £25m; the police £21m; the courts system spends more than £10m without accounting for the cost of legal aid; and the NHS - a conservative estimate is £55m.
The Human Rights Act only requires translation if someone is arrested or charged with a criminal offence.
Translating is not only expensive it is doing harm because it reinforces the language barrier which separates communities from the rest of Britain and hinders integration.

attributes.action: Change the redundancy law around workers who were full time & are now part time.
attributes.background: The law is very clear, It is defined as this "it is your part-time position which is being made redundant, you are therefore being compensated for your current part-time position." This is regardless of any previous full-time service, even if that is 10+ yrs of dedication over 2 yrs of part-time.
attributes.additional_details: In my opinion, those who are affected by this are those that have had a family or are a dedicated caregiver. With years of unwavering service to their company & returning part time, how is it justifiable not to consider that service at a time when it is most needed. What if  the job specification never changed, what if you are supporting a full-time role on part-time hours, which is the majority of cases. Redundancy is based on a calculation, a formula, that formula can be adapted.

attributes.action: Make the result of debates triggered by these Petitions binding on Government.
attributes.background: Government's response to the 2nd Referendum Petition, which has gained over 4 million signatures, let slip that any debate triggered by it would have no legal force. We may be wasting our time participating in these petitions unless that changes.
attributes.additional_details:
I quote as evidence this, taken from the initial response to the 2nd Referendum petition:
'The Committee wishes to make clear that, although it may choose to schedule a debate on this petition in due course, it only has the power to schedule debates in Westminster Hall – the second debating chamber of the House of Commons. Debates in Westminster Hall do not have the power to change the law, and could not trigger a second referendum.'

attributes.action: Urge India to allow UNHRC intervention in Kashmir
attributes.background: On 17/08/16, the UNHRC stated that it 'could only assume the worst' following the failure of the Indian authorities to grant its office access to Kashmir. Recently, thousands of civilians have been injured by armed forces during continuing protests across the region. Death toll now exceeds 60.
attributes.additional_details: Refusal to allow a UNHRC visit comes at a time when the Indian state stands accused of using disproportionate force to crush protests. To date, military-occupied Kashmir has seen over 70000 killings, 8000+ enforced disappearances & countless cases of torture & sexual violence. The Indian state has given impunity to its armed forces so as to protect them from prosecution for international crimes, including war crimes. The state stands in violation of its own laws as well as international laws.

attributes.action: Make spitting of Paan in public places a Civil offence.
attributes.background: Paan is a preparation combining betel leaf with areca nut and sometimes also with tobacco.It is chewed for its stimulant and psychoactive effects.
attributes.additional_details: Paan made with areca nut and lime, with or without tobacco, causes profuse red coloured salivation.This saliva is spat, yielding stains and biological waste pollution in public spaces. Many countries and municipalities have laws to prevent paan spit.Health effects of chewing paan: gum damage, tooth decay and oral cancer.

attributes.action: Dissolve Parliament after leadership elections to trigger a General Election
attributes.background: I believe that no public mandate exists for the incumbent government and the period of government following the EU referendum is too important to proceed without such a mandate.

attributes.action: Make voting compulsory in elections and referendums, similar to Australian law.
attributes.background: Voters are obliged to vote in elections or attend a poling station, or log a postal vote, if they do not they could be subject to a penalty, such as fines or community service. Currently there are 22 countries, including Australia, that have this system.

attributes.action: Ban pre packed cooked bones being sold as dog treats
attributes.background:
Many dog owners are unaware of the dangers of giving their dog cooked bones. 
Lots of shops in the uk (not just pet shops) sell pre packed cooked bones as dog treats which are sold to dog owners everyday! Cooked bones can be deadly to dogs and many die every year because of this

attributes.action: Referendum for the people to decide whether we should end the TV License Fee/Tax
attributes.background: The BBC coverage of the UK Referendum has not been free of political bias. Whether it comes to BBC News reporting, prominently featuring Remain side arguments and showing Leave side arguments playing second fiddle to the BBC Website which has done the same. As for the BBC Fact Checker that is biased

attributes.action: Make ABP and other former public sector bodies protect historic buildings.
attributes.background: Grimsby was once the largest fishing port in the world.  Associated British Ports (ABP) is demolishing the 19th century buildings at the heart of the historic port of Grimsby.  ABP have permitted development rights - no planning application is needed.
attributes.additional_details: ABP was formerly the British Transport Docks Board.  Other industries formerly in the public sector have legal duties to consider historic buildings (e.g. in Water Industry Act 1991, section 3 and Electricity Act 1989, Schedule 9).  The law should be changed so that ABP (and other bodies formerly in the public sector) are subject to similar duties.

attributes.action: Improve the social welfare safety net for people fleeing domestic abuse
attributes.background: Domestic abuse is a horrific situation for anyone to find themselves in & especially difficult for anyone who has to make decisions not just about their wellbeing but for children in their care. 2 women are killed weekly in the UK-if people feel they can leave safely this number may be reduced.
attributes.additional_details:
There is an alarming lack of support for people fleeing domestic abuse, especially women/families. This manifests the deprivation that families often experience moving out from an abuser or from a shelter.

"The threat of poverty is often described as being ‘among the most formidable'" barriers (NOWLDEF, 2002:1) from leaving toxic - in some cases deadly - situations with serious consequences. This hole in the social safety net is short-sighted in both its financial and societal implications.

attributes.action: Establish economic tests to assess readiness for Brexit.
attributes.background: The decision to leave the European Union will have huge consequences for the United Kingdom. The economic tests that were created to assess readiness for EMU provide a model for taking proper account of the economic consequences prior to notifying the EU of our intention to leave under Article 50.
attributes.additional_details: Various attempts have been made to estimate the cost to the UK of Brexit. Such an estimate has to take into account potential loss of trade, inward investment and joint R&D, as well as additional spending on the military, borders, redundancy and pensions, and bureaucracy. This is against the background of record debt (approx. 90% GDP). Parliament should establish metrics for the economic impact of each Brexit scenario (e.g. so-called hard or soft) so that an informed decision can be made.

attributes.action: Stop street beggars from using live animals to support their begging.
attributes.background:
All over London's West End tourist spots there are gangs of Eastern Europeans using dogs to aid their begging.
The dogs are dressed up in clothes, hats and sunglasses, and are made to to sit out in all weathers for hours to attract the public and encourage them to give money.

attributes.action: Replace religious education in UK schools with a comparative history of religion
attributes.background: Religion can be the cause of social and educational schism.
attributes.additional_details: School is our first experience of institutional life and so, as a priority, it should be inclusive and harmonised from the outset. Religion is used in our schools as a context to teach ethics. A Comparative History of Religion will foster objectivity and tolerance, which are themselves virtuous. A Comparative History of Religion will produce an empirical lesson in social harmony that is psychologically wholesome, undeniable and therefore enduring.

attributes.action: Allow all people diagnosed with an ASC to access concessionary travel passes
attributes.background: The law as it stands regarding concessionary travel passes is discriminatory and outdated. For people with an Autistic Spectrum Condition there is a postcode lottery of access depending on their local council's definition of a "learning disability". This discrepancy must be resolved.
attributes.additional_details: The DSMv (diagnostic standards manual) effectively did away with the distinctions that had previously been drawn between autistic spectrum conditions. For several years now the standard diagnosis is for ASC and IQ is no longer routinely tested. This means that children are unable to meet the criteria for concessionary travel, despite their genuine social and sensory difficulties in accessing public transport. The guidelines must be updated.

attributes.action: Reinstate the 2006 plan for all new homes built after 2016 to be zero carbon.
attributes.background: The plan would have ensured that all new dwellings from 2016 would generate as much energy on-site – via renewable sources, e.g. wind or solar energy – as they would use in heating, hot water, lighting and ventilation. This would be alongside tighter energy efficiency standards.
attributes.additional_details:
Zero Carbon homes are not more expensive - designers at Cardiff University built a zero carbon house at no extra cost here: (http://www.bbc.com/news/science-environment-33544831). Also, they will be cheaper to run as energy costs could be zero or even negative, therefore earning the owners money.
As well as the economic benefits of zero carbon homes, reducing carbon emissions is also important for climate change; and reducing energy dependency on other countries (i.e. by importing gas and oil)

attributes.action: A Gen Election before Article 50, free of first past the post for EU membership.
attributes.background:
We dispute the EU referendum result; due to numbers against and that the Leave Campaign substantially misled the Electorate.  

Both Conservatives and Labour have promised to enforce the vote.  This promise blocks at least 48% of the Electorate from revisiting this issue in elections due (cont)
attributes.additional_details:
(cont) to the first past the post rule violating almost half of the UK’s democratic rights.

We demand a general election free of the first past the post rule to determine EU membership prior to invoking Article 50, so as to give the maximum number of the British people a voice in their country's future.

http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/jun/26/eu-referendum-brexit-vote-leave-iain-duncan-smith-nhs

Cameron and Corbyn are on record as respecting the referendum result to exit the EU.

attributes.action: We should have a referendum to quit NATO and save us from starting a major war.
attributes.background: NATO is not big enough to win a war against Russia, but large enough to start a world war.  This makes it a waste of tax payers money.  NATO has broken its agreement to expand beyond Germany, causing unease with Russia and making us impose US led sanctions, which have made UK farmers suffer.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/601058/Britain-European-Union-Russia-Foreign-Policy-Agriculture-Farmers-Dairy-Phil-Hogan-Milk

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/french-farmers-block-roads-in-protest-at-huge-drop-in-milk-and-pork-prices-following-russian-trade-a6875581.html

http://www.southeastfarmer.net/section/news/eu-sanctions-hit-uk-fruit-growers

attributes.action: Make it law that cyclist's have to wear a high vis jacket.
attributes.background: Make it law that cyclist's have to wear a high vis jacket with reflective strips at all time when on the road and no headphones. To help them to be seen by motorists and they can hear what is happening on the road. This is after truck and car drivers are getting blamed for deaths of cyclists.

attributes.action: House of Commons should support the 'Taxes for Peace' Bill.
attributes.background:
The 'Taxes for Peace' bill will allow UK citizens the choice 'to divert the portion of their taxes that would ordinarily pay for military operations into a conflict prevention fund'. 
The bill was proposed by MP Ruth Cadbury on 19th July and could receive its second reading on 2nd December.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.conscienceonline.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/06/Taxes-for-Peace-Bill-2016.pdf

attributes.action: Make the North East Combined Authority give the people a vote on Devolution
attributes.background:
SUNDERLAND COUNCIL LEADER PAUL WATSON HAS TOLD THE NEWCASTLE CHRONICLE WE THE PUBLIC DON’T WANT A VOTE ON DEVOLUTION 
HE SEEMS TO HAVE FORGOTTEN WE HAVE ALREADY VOTED ON DEVOLUTION IN 2004 AND IT WAS A MASSIVE MAJORITY TO REJECT DEVOLUTION

attributes.action: Change the house buying process in England, Wales and NI
attributes.background: A petition to address the requirement of consumer protection when purchasing or selling a property. Minimising financial exposure and risk after price agreement and the subsequent common terms of sale changes; gazumping, gazundering and pulling out. MPs to create safeguards in earlier commitment.

attributes.action: Amend the  Dog Act to include taking DNA of every dog to be kept with Microchip.
attributes.background: Due to the high number of dog attacks the aim is to force all dog owners to have their dog DNA taken and  register it with the dog's microchip. This  would allow all dogs to be screened for banned breed DNA and if attacks take place wounds could be swabbed and aggressors traced.
attributes.additional_details:
If a dog is  already microchipped the addresses are known and the owners could be contacted and asked to get the DNA profile done.
The DNA would also help with tracing of owners of dogs who leave poo uncollected, which will help District Councils prosecute culprits.

attributes.action: Say no to the single market and 7 year immigration brake, leave means leave.
attributes.background: Brexit, leave means leave say no to the single market and say no to the 7 year immigration brake, after 7 years we would be back to square one.

attributes.action: Put and end to UK circuses using animals as part of their 'performances'.
attributes.background: Along with you I feel it is extremely necessary to put an end to the abusive, cruel and unorthodox ways in which animals are treated in order to 'perform' to an audience. Awareness for this issue is preposterously inadequate and a lot more action against this compulsory to make a difference.
attributes.additional_details:
One case study to get a taste of the happens that are kept away from the public is Anne the elephant: 

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1370050/Britains-circus-elephant-Anne-Battered-kicked-stabbed.html 

These animals are put through a life of pain for a number of hours worth of entertainment, surely everybody can see the imbalance in this.

attributes.action: Give all 16 and 17 year olds the vote in referenda that affect their future
attributes.background: In the June 2016 referendum on whether to remain in the UK, 16 and 17 year old citizens have been denied a say on this important question, yet will endure its consequences for the next 60 to 70 years. Their fate has been decided by older people who have less at stake. This is morally wrong.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory to display a halal food sign in businesses serving halal food.
attributes.background: All businesses serving halal food should clearly display a sign at the entrance of their establishment stating that the food they serve is halal. This would allow people of the Muslim faith to clearly identify where they are permitted to eat and Sikhs to identify where they cannot eat.

attributes.action: Hold a public enquiry into the legitimacy of the result of the EU Referendum.
attributes.background: The EU Referendum vote to leave the EU will make an irreversible change to the UK’s relationship to the rest of world. Remain and Leave campaigns, and unofficial campaigns, mislead the public on key factual information about our current and future relationship with the EU and the rest of the world.
attributes.additional_details:
We have a principal in the UK that we are not allowed to gain advantage by knowingly lying. Yet that is what has happened with the EU referendum. Both campaigns made statements that were not true.

The Leave campaign has achieved a narrow victory and we are now told that their main campaign promise “We send the EU £350 million a week let’s fund the NHS instead” is not possible.

We need an enquiry into the legitimacy of the result that is based on lies  by both campaigns to acquire support.

attributes.action: Ban smoking on footpaths, walkways and public places
attributes.background: Passive smoking is becoming a serious health issue, specifically in urban area. Every morning, thousands of non-smokers have to face passive smoking while going to work as other people smoke on footpaths and walkways. A large number of people do not use designated smoking zones.
attributes.additional_details:
A quick look at this article from Cancer Research UK will tell us how dangerous passive smoking can be - http://www.cancerresearchuk.org/about-cancer/causes-of-cancer/smoking-and-cancer/passive-smoking

Unwanted passive smoking on the streets of major UK cities is causing health issues that are not very easy to detect in early stages. Overall, passive smoking is affecting the health of non-smokers living or working in urban areas in a significant way.

attributes.action: Fit seat belts on all public transport where there are seats provided.
attributes.background: Please would you consider fitting seat belts on all public transport where there are seats available, for the safety of the public. Cars, mini buses & cabs require this as law. Thank you.

attributes.action: Bring back Art History A Level
attributes.background: One of the main reasons I am now doing a degree in History of Art was because I studied it for A Level. This academic discipline explores and analyses the oldest form of human expression, older than literature, language and music. Without the chance to study it at school, the subject will disappear.

attributes.action: UK govt to strongly condemn India for genocide of innocent Kashmiri muslims
attributes.background: Kashmiri muslims are asking for their right of freedom, which was conferred to them according to UN resolutions. They want Their right of plebiscite. Indian army is killing innocent and unarmed Kashmiri Muslims. Killings should be stopped immediately and Kashmiri should be invited for dialogue.

attributes.action: A constitution that forbids our Parliament ceding sovereignty to foreign powers.
attributes.background: This would prevent governments gradually ceding sovereignty to foreign powers as they have done for example over the last 44 years to the EU treaty by treaty.
attributes.additional_details:
Tony Benn on the Lisbon treaty & the EU > https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GTjg-vt0Ao4

'If parliament transfers sovereignty away in treaties such as Lisbon then it is stealing rights that don't belong to it because an MP is lent powers of the public for 5 years

But if in those 5 years you give it away to somebody else then you can't repeal those laws. This is a theft of public rights.'

attributes.action: Better pay for support workers and carers they are the backbone of this country.
attributes.background: Carers, supported living and especially nursing homes, are the backbone of this country. Right now, the care sector and social welfare sector is suffering to the point of collapse. It is the backbone of this country. In order to attract a quality of care, the rate of pay MUST be increased.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/social-care-network/2015/jan/20/care-workers-better-pay-conditions

This article in the guardian more or less sums up the whole situation. 

If we are to attract a quality of staff that is prepared to actually "care" then we must give those staff the incentive to come and do so. Right now, the wage is slow low it is almost in design to attract abuse, negativity and bad care. And those who do care are pushed to their limit financially and emotionally. This must change.

attributes.action: Call on the Government to send in the Army to protect lorry Drivers in France.
attributes.background: Due to increase on attacks to lorry drivers in Calais France before someone gets killed or serious injury to send over troops to protect the drivers and their lorries also the cost to damaged or soiled goods and maybe the destruction of businesses.

attributes.action: Make it law for all horse riders to wear hi-viz clothing when riding on the road
attributes.background:
As a horse rider, nothing infuriates me more than other riders who risk themselves and their horses by hacking on roads not wearing hi-viz. 
We expect drivers and other road users to slow down when passing us so we should make sure we can be seen well in advance.
attributes.additional_details:
Wearing hi-viz increases visibility by seconds. 
By not wearing it riders increase the risk of accident.

Be safe, be seen!
